# letsR ![](reference/figures/letsr.png)

## The package

The letsR package is being developed to help researchers handle,
process, and analyze macroecological data. It aims to integrate these
methodological processes into a single software platform for
macroecological analyses. The package’s main functions allow users to
build presence-absence matrices, the primary analytical tool in
macroecology, from species’ geographical distributions and merge them
with species’ traits, conservation information and spatial environmental
layers. In addition, other packages’ functions enable users to summarize
and visualize data from presence-absence matrices.

All functions in this package use a prefix and a suffix separated by a
dot; the prefix refers to the package’s name, and the suffix to the
actual function. This nomenclature avoids confusion with potentially
similarly-named functions from other R packages. For instance, the letsR
function used to create presence-absence matrices is called
`lets.presab` (but see also `lets.presab.birds` and
`lets.presab.points`), whereas the one used to add variables to a
presence-absence matrix is called `lets.addvar`.  
The package’s primary functions create and work on a particular S3
object class called `PresenceAbsence`. Such `PresenceAbsence` object
class allows storing information beyond presence-absence data
(e.g. user-defined grid-cell system) and using the generic `plot`,
`summary` and `print` functions of R. Also, some package’s functions
allow the user to input customary R objects (e.g. `vector`, `matrix`,
`data.frame`).

The letsR package is in continuous development, and suggestions are more
than welcome!

We hope you enjoy it and find it helpful.

## Package publication

<https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/2041-210X.12401>

## Install

Install `letsR` from CRAN

``` coffee
install.packages("letsR")
library("letsR")
```

Install `letsR` developers version from github

``` coffee
install.packages("devtools")
library(devtools)
install_github("macroecology/letsR")
library(letsR)
```

OBS.: To download the developers version you will need to have the git
software installed (<https://git-scm.com/>). If you are a windows user
you will also need to download the Rtools
(<https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/>).

## Note

Due to changes in the IUCN API and limitations in data distribution
established by IUCN terms of use, we are no longer maintaining the
functions lets.iucn, lets.iucn.hist and lets.iucn.ha. These functions
will be removed from the package in the next version. We apologize for
any inconvenience this may cause.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`IUCN`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/IUCN.md) : IUCN
  evaluation for frogs of the genus Phyllomedusa
- [`PAM`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/PAM.md) :
  PresenceAbsence object for frogs of the genus Phyllomedusa
- [`Phyllomedusa`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/Phyllomedusa.md)
  : Phyllomedusa
- [`PresenceAbsence`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/PresenceAbsence.md)
  [`PresenceAbsence-class`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/PresenceAbsence.md)
  : PresenceAbsence Class
- [`lets.pamcrop()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.PAMcrop.md)
  : Crop a PresenceAbsence object based on an input shapefile
- [`lets.addpoly()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.addpoly.md)
  : Add polygon coverage to a PresenceAbscence object
- [`lets.addvar()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.addvar.md)
  : Add variables (in raster format) to a PresenceAbscence object
- [`lets.attrcells()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.attrcells.md)
  : Descriptors of centrality, border proximity, and isolation in
  attribute space
- [`lets.attrpam()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.attrpam.md)
  : Attribute-space Presence–Absence Matrix (attrPAM)
- [`lets.classvar()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.classvar.md)
  : Frequency distribution of a variable within a species' range
- [`lets.correl()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.correl.md)
  : Compute correlogram based on the Moran's I index
- [`lets.distmat()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.distmat.md)
  : Compute a geographic distance matrix
- [`lets.envcells()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.envcells.md)
  : Environmental descriptors for Presence–Absence in environmental
  space
- [`lets.envpam()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.envpam.md)
  : Create a presence–absence matrix in environmental space
- [`lets.field()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.field.md)
  : Create species' values based on the species co-occurrence within
  focal ranges
- [`lets.gridirizer()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.gridirizer.md)
  : Fits a grid into a PresenceAbsence object
- [`lets.iucncont()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.iucncont.md)
  : Transform IUCN RedList conservation status to continuous values
- [`lets.load()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.load.md)
  : Load a PresenceAbsence object
- [`lets.maplizer()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.maplizer.md)
  : Create a matrix summarizing species' attributes within cells of a
  PresenceAbsence object
- [`lets.maplizer.attr()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.maplizer.attr.md)
  : Map species-level attributes over the attribute-space grid
- [`lets.maplizer.env()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.maplizer.env.md)
  : Map species attributes in both environmental and geographic spaces
- [`lets.midpoint()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.midpoint.md)
  : Compute the midpoint of species' geographic ranges
- [`lets.overlap()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.overlap.md)
  : Compute pairwise species' geographic overlaps
- [`lets.plot.attrcells()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.plot.attrcells.md)
  : Map AttrPAM descriptor layers
- [`lets.plot.attrpam()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.plot.attrpam.md)
  : Plot attrPAM results
- [`lets.plot.envcells()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.plot.envcells.md)
  : Map envPAM descriptors
- [`lets.plot.envpam()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.plot.envpam.md)
  : Plot species richness in environmental and geographical space
- [`lets.presab()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.presab.md)
  : Create a presence-absence matrix of species' geographic ranges
  within a grid
- [`lets.presab.birds()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.presab.birds.md)
  : Create a presence-absence matrix of species' geographic ranges
  within a grid for the Birdlife spatial data
- [`lets.presab.grid()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.presab.grid.md)
  : Create a presence-absence matrix of species' geographic ranges
  within a user's grid shapefile (beta version)
- [`lets.presab.grid.points()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.presab.grid.points.md)
  : Create a presence-absence matrix based on species' point occurrences
  within a user's grid shapefile (beta version)
- [`lets.presab.points()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.presab.points.md)
  : Create a presence-absence matrix based on species' point occurrences
- [`lets.rangesize()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.rangesize.md)
  : Compute species' geographic range sizes
- [`lets.save()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.save.md)
  : Save a PresenceAbsence object
- [`lets.shFilter()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.shFilter.md)
  : Filter species' shapefiles based on its presence, origin, and season
- [`lets.subsetPAM()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.subsetPAM.md)
  : Subset a PresenceAbsence object based on species names
- [`lets.summarizer()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.summarizer.md)
  : Summarize variable(s) values in a presence-absence matrix within
  species' ranges
- [`lets.summaryze.cells()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.summaryze.cells.md)
  : Aggregate cell-wise metrics across occupied cells per species
- [`lets.transf()`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/lets.transf.md)
  : Transform values of a vector
- [`letsR-package`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/letsR-package.md)
  [`letsR`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/letsR-package.md)
  : Tools for Data Handling and Analysis in Macroecology.
- [`plot(`*`<PresenceAbsence>`*`)`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/plot.PresenceAbsence.md)
  : Plot an object of class PresenceAbsence
- [`prec`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/prec.md) :
  Annual Precipitation raster for the world.
- [`print(`*`<PresenceAbsence>`*`)`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/print.PresenceAbsence.md)
  : Print for object of class PresenceAbsence
- [`print.summary(`*`<PresenceAbsence>`*`)`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/print.summary.PresenceAbsence.md)
  : Print summary for object of class PresenceAbsence
- [`summary(`*`<PresenceAbsence>`*`)`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/summary.PresenceAbsence.md)
  : Summary for object of class PresenceAbsence
- [`temp`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/temp.md) : Mean
  temperature raster for the world.
- [`wrld_simpl`](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/reference/wrld_simpl.md)
  : Simplified world country polygons

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [A guide to transform species distributions into a presence absence
  matrix based on a user-defined grid in
  R](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/A-guide-to-transform-species-distributions-into-a-presence-absence-matrix-based.md):
- [Adding variables to a PresenceAbsence
  object](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/Adding-variables-to-a-presenceabsence-object.md):
- [Cropping and subseting your presence absence
  matrix](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/cropping-and-subseting-your-presence-absence-matrix.md):
- [Cross-mapping biodiversity metrics across
  spaces](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/Cross-mapping-biodiversity-metrics-Phyllomedusa.md):
- [Mapping species richness in attribute
  space](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/Mapping-species-richness-in-attribute-space.md):
- [Mapping species richness in environmental
  space](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/Mapping-species-richness-in-environmental-space.md):
- [Mapping species traits: community level
  analysis](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/mapping-species-traits.md):
- [How to save and load a PresenceAbsence
  object](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/save-load-presenceabsence.md):
- [Macroecological analysis at the species
  level](https://brunovilela.github.io/letsR/articles/species-level-macroecological-analysis.md):
